intro: Tetranthera tomentosa, commonly known as the woolly tetranthera, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and small, pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
